column5: This degree apprenticeship programme provides health care practitioners with the opportunity to develop the advanced skills necessary to independently manage holistic episodes of physical and mental healthcare in a range of settings including acute, primary and emergency settings (including hospitals, general practice, individual’s homes, schools, prisons, and in the public, independent, private and charitable sectors).
column7: You can apply for the loan to study a taught, research or professional master's programme e.g. MA, MSc, LLM, MRes, MBA, MARM, MCD of up to £11,836 (for courses starting in the academic year 2022/23). For courses starting in the next academic year (2023/24) students will be eligible for up to £12,167
